revised_title: Pharmacologically Active Substances in the Garden Tiger Moth
tldr: The authors discovered a pharmacologically active choline ester in the garden tiger moth, Arctia caja, which resembles acetylcholine. They also found a heat-labile, non-dialyzable substance in the moth's abdominal tissues that increases capillary permeability and causes death on intravenous injection. These substances may play a role in the moth's defense mechanisms.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Insect Physiology
